Storm to bring most snow to western and central Mass.

Central Massachusetts will see six to eight inches of snow and areas in the western part of the state will see a bit more, forecasters said. (Boston Globe, 1:41 p.m.)

Farrell names Hanrahan as his closer

Joel Hanrahan will be the closer going into spring training and Andrew Bailey will be a set-up man, the Sox assistant general manager said. (Globe, 3:23 p.m.)

T ridership increases again in November

T ridership up for 20th time in 22 months

Daily ridership increased by 1.3 percent compared to November 2011, and averaged 1.3 million passenger trips per weekday, the T said. (Boston Globe, 1:54 p.m.)

For many young people who move away for college, coming home for the holidays also means coming out to their families as lesbian, gay, or bisexual.

Move to new college can be tough

Many transfer students say they feel neglected by school officials once they arrive, and often have a difficult time assimilating to a new campus.

Health & Wellness

Study: Overweight kids may
need a vitamin D boost

The study analyzed data from more than 12,000 kids aged six to 18. About 21 percent of kids with healthy weights were vitamin D deficient but nearly 50 percent of those who were severely obese were deficient.
